Proposal Invitation for Fire Protection Systems and Building Repairs at Lower Fort Garry National Historic Site #[PW-22-01003821] #[5P468-22-0065.A]
========================================================================================================================
### Tender Details
Date of Publication: 2022-08-09T00:00Z  
Tender Due Date: 2022-09-21T16:00:00  
Contracting Entity: Parks Canada  
### Notice Type
This is a Competitive Request for Proposal (RFP) to hire a contractor to complete rehabilitation and repairs of three heritage buildings at Lower Fort Garry National Historic Site.  
The proposed works include repairs and upgrades to fire protection, heating, and electrical systems, as well as architectural restoration due to a malfunctioning sprinkler system. The estimated contract value is between $250,001 and $500,000.  
The successful contractor will be required to perform and complete the work within 26 weeks from notification of acceptance of the offer.  
### Mandatory and Permissive Requirements  
Mandatory Requirements and instructions to suppliers are detailed in the Special Instructions to Bidders (STBs) and the Supply Arrangement To-Standard (SAT) for 5201 – Contract or Task Contract.  
Permissive requirements and related brochures, policies, or procedures are as follows: 
  * A two-submission process will be followed for this bid. Refer to section IP04 of the STBs.  
  * To assist with bonding and insurance requirements, contractors may need to obtain additional funding from their surety.  
URLs to relevant documents can be accessed by clicking on this link [Government Electronic Tendering Service](https://buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders).  
  * In case of discrepancies in English and French documents, please submit them to the contracting authority at your earliest convenience.  
  * Please address any technical or contractual queries 5 business days before the closing date for the tender.  
### Security Requirement
Please be advised that a personnel security requirement is associated with this bid.  
New personnel security clearance requests may require mandatory fingerprints for a criminal record check. The contracting authority will not undertake any costs associated with this process. Applicants should ensure that all required documents are submitted on time and are complete.  
### Required Documents
Short-listing and the procurement process will be guided by Section 4 of the new revisions to Good Practice Charters adopted by the Interagency Group on Procurement (IGP) as of [23/03/2022].
